DPRD Jabar Dorong Pemerintah Daerah Optimalisasi Pemberdayaan Masyarakat
01 Nov 2019, 02:45 by Ecep Sukirman
BANDUNG, (PR).- Anggota Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat Daerah (DPRD) Jawa Barat Asep Wahyuwijaya turut mempertanyakan pernyataan Pemerintah Provinsi Jawa Barat mengenai tingginya investasi di Jawa Barat. Selain itu, pada saat bersamaan ada eksodus dari pengusaha yang hengkang dari Jawa Barat ke daerah lain karena alasan tingginya upah kerja di Jawa Barat.
Namun di lain sisi, tuntutan kehidupan layak masyarakat Jawa Barat juga semakin tinggi. Dengan demikian, dalam menetapkan upah minimum padat karya ini harus sangat berhati-hati.
“Investasi itu penting dan harus ada dampak terhadap perbaikan mutu kesejahteraan masyarakat. Buruh menuntut upah tinggi karena beban (kebutuhan) hidupnya juga semakin tinggi. Ini tidak bisa dilihat dari sisi mengenai hubungan industrial, tetapi juga peran pemerintah yang seharusnya mampu mendorong tingkat daya beli semakin kuat dan mampu menahan laju harga kebutuhan pokok masyarakat,” ujar dia, Kamis, 31 Oktober 2019.
Asep menuturkan, jika saat ini pemerintah mampu menjalankan pemberdayaan masyarakat dengan berbagai programnya secara optimal, maka pihaknya meyakini daya beli masyarakat akan menguat. Sehingga, masyarakat tidak terbebani dengan mahalnya kebutuhan pokok karena mampu membelinya. Selain itu, pemerintah juga wajib menyediakan infrastruktur memadai agar ongkos produksi tidak melebihi batas kewajaran.
“Pangkal masalahnya kan di daya beli. Kalau daya beli masyarakat kuat, saya yakin kebutuhan hidup layak masyarakat akan tercukupi. Pembenahan daya beli ini kan ada di pemerintah. Selain itu, pengusaha juga akan nyaman dan aman berinvestasi di Jawa Barat. Tingginya permintaan upah ini kan untuk mengimbangi harga kebutuhan hidup yang saat ini serba mahal,” ujar dia seraya menambahkan peran pemerintah pun harus mampu menciptakan kondisi aman dan nyaman bagi semua kalangan, baik pengusaha, buruh, maupun masyarakat luas.
Sebelumnya, menyikapi adanya kekhawatiran pelaku industri padat karya yang terancam tutup dan hengkang dari Jawa Barat akibat tingginya upah minimum padat karya yang selalu meningkat, Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat Daerah (DPRD) Jawa Barat memandang pemerintah justru perlu menguatkan daya beli masyarakat di tengah tingginya harga kebutuhan pokok. Sebab, akibat tingginya kebutuhan hidup layak di Jawa Barat, juga menjadi salah satu pemicu tingginya permintaan upah.
Ketua Komisi V DPRD Jawa Barat, Dadang Kurniawan mengatakan, adanya desakan dari pengusaha kepada Gubernur Jawa Barat Ridwan Kamil mengenai penetapan upah minimum padat karya ini, hal itu harus dibahas bersama-sama antara pemerintah, pengusaha, dan pekerja. Dijelaskan dia, sebenarnya tuntutan buruh juga tidak terlalu berlebihan jika dibandingkan dengan tingginya kebutuhan hidup layak, misalnya mahalnya harga kebutuhan pokok.
Saat ini, kata Dadang, meskipun diikat dengan Tripartit namun pada kenyataannya masing-masing elemen ini berjalan pada posisi tawar sendiri-sendiri. Sehingga pada saat ada persoalan, masing-masing elemen ini menjalankan keputusannya masing-masing. Misalnya, kata dia, ada kekhawatiran pengusaha akan gulung tikar dan memilih hengkang ke luar Jawa Barat saat upah minimumnya dirasa tinggi.
“Dari sisi kaum buruh juga saat ingin naik (upah), cukup dengan demo. Sedangkan posisi pemerintah juga cukup dengan hanya menampung dan meng-iyakan apa yang menjadi aspirasi mereka (buruh dan pengusaha). Dari dulu itu teh. Cobalah ada keseriusan dari pemerintah, pengusaha, dan buruh untuk duduk bersama dan membicarakan masalah ini dengan terbuka dan menjalankan komitmennya bersama-sama, bukan melakukan cara-caranya sendiri-sendiri yang dapat merugikan semua pihak,” tutur dia.***

West Java DPRD Encourages Local Government to Optimize Community Empowerment
Nov 01 2019, 02:45 by Ecep Sukirman
BANDUNG, (PR) .- Member of the West Java Regional House of Representatives (DPRD) Asep Wahyuwijaya also questioned the West Java Provincial Government's statement regarding the high investment in West Java. In addition, at the same time there was an exodus from employers who fled from West Java to other regions due to the high wage in West Java.
But on the other hand, the demands of a decent life for the people of West Java are also getting higher. Thus, in setting labor-intensive minimum wages this must be very careful.
"Investment is important and there must be an impact on improving the quality of people's welfare. Workers demand high wages because the burden (needs) of their lives are also higher. This cannot be seen from the side of industrial relations, but also the role of the government which should be able to push the level of purchasing power stronger and be able to hold the price of the basic needs of the community, "he said, Thursday, 31 October 2019.
Asep said, if currently the government is able to run community empowerment with various programs optimally, then it believes that people's purchasing power will strengthen. So, people are not burdened with the high cost of basic needs because they can afford it. In addition, the government is also required to provide adequate infrastructure so that production costs do not exceed reasonable limits.
"The root of the problem is purchasing power. If the purchasing power of the community is strong, I am sure that the needs of a decent living for the community will be fulfilled. The improvement of purchasing power is in the government. In addition, entrepreneurs will also be comfortable and safe investing in West Java. The high demand for wages is to offset the current price of living necessities, "he said, adding that the role of the government must also be able to create safe and comfortable conditions for all groups, both employers, laborers, and the wider community.
Previously, addressing the concerns of labor-intensive industry players who were threatened with closing and leaving West Java due to the high labor-intensive minimum wage that was always increasing, the Regional Representative Council (DPRD) of West Java saw the government instead needing to strengthen people's purchasing power amidst the high price of basic necessities . Because, due to the high need for a decent living in West Java, it is also one of the triggers for the high demand for wages.
Chairman of Commission V of the West Java DPRD, Dadang Kurniawan said, there was a pressure from employers to the Governor of West Java Ridwan Kamil regarding the establishment of this labor-intensive minimum wage. He explained, in fact the demands of workers were also not too excessive when compared to the high needs of decent living, for example the high price of basic necessities.
At present, said Dadang, although bound by Tripartite, in reality, each of these elements runs in their own bargaining position. So that when there is a problem, each of these elements carries out their respective decisions. For example, he said, there are fears that employers will go out of business and choose to leave outside West Java when the minimum wage is considered high.
"From the side of the workers also when they want to increase (wages), enough with a demo. Whereas the government position is also sufficient to only accommodate and express their aspirations (workers and employers). Tea was always from the first. Try there is the seriousness of the government, employers, and workers to sit together and discuss this issue openly and carry out their commitments together, not to do their own ways that can harm all parties, "he said. ***
